bibl.title: Sterling P. White v. John Cody. Type of document

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Spokane County Government; Clerk, Territorial Case Files, 1879-1889

div1.p: TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON, County of Spokane } SS.

Territory of Washington
Plaintiff
vs.
Stephen Sterling P. White
Defendant }
In the District Court of the Territory of Washington and for the First Fourth Judicial District thereof, holding terms at Cheney, Spokane County, in said Territory

To the Sheriff of Spokane Lincoln County, Greeting: IN THE NAME OF THE UNITED STATES, You are hereby commanded to summon Wells Williams Eva Stephey to be and appear before the District Court aforesaid at the Court House, in Cheney, in said County, on the forthwith day of April A.D. 1885, at o'clock, M. to there give evidence in the above entitiled cause on the part of said Defendant S.P. White
Witness the Hon. George Turner Associate Judge of the Supreme Court of Washington Territory, and Judge of said Court, and the Seal thereof affixed, this 20 day of April A.D. 1885
Kate W. Feuerbach Clerk. By R. Strobach Deputy.
TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON, County of Spokane Lincoln } SS.
I hereby certify that I served the within Subpoena on the within named witness by reading the same to him in said County, on this 20 & 24th day of April A.D. 1885
Jno Cody Sheriff By J.M. Friedlander, Deputy.
In the District Court of the Territory of Washington, and for the First Judicial District thereof, holding Terms at Cheney, Spokane County, in said Territory

Territory
Plaintiff
vs.
Stephen Sterling P. White
Defendant
Returned and Filed this 25 day of, April A.D. 1885

Kate W. Feuerbach Clerk.
By. R. Strobach Deputy.

Sheriff's Fees
Serving 2 names at 40 80
Mileage 4 miles at 10 40
Total, ---$120
